Detailed Description

Class for handling with a fitting function defined as , where is a Landau function and is a Gaus function.

Detailed description follows here.

Member Function Documentation

double Langaus::findePeak (  ) 

Calculate error of peak position , where are parameters of function.

The error is calculated with the formula . The correlation factors are obtained by fit.

See also:
getCorrelation(const char*, const char*)

Definition at line 234 of file Langaus.cc.

References _ePeak, _peak, and findPeak().

Referenced by langaufit().

double Langaus::findPeak ( const double *  par  ) 

Find peak position for given parameters.

Precision of finding the peak position is given by number of points in Fast Fourier transformation (FFT) and by ratio of width of "binning" to range of fit for direct numerical computation. The number of points for FFT can be adjusted by setFFTCache and ratio by setNumRatio.

Parameters:
par - pointer to array of three parameters: par[0]=Landau mean, par[1]=Landau sigma, par[2]=Gaus sigma

double Langaus::getCorrelation ( const char *  par1,
const char *  par2 
)

Obtain fit correlation factors between parameters (Landau mean, Landau sigma, Gaus sigma) obtained by fit.

Parameters:
par1,par2 - parameters of fitting function given as: "ml"(Landau mean), "sl"(Landau sigma), "sg"(Gaus sigma).
Returns:
Correlation between parameters given as inputs. If inputs are wrong, return value is 0.

double *  fitparams,
double *  fiterrors,
double &  peak,
double &  epeak 
)

Make whole fit of dataset with numerical finding of peak position and propagated error estimation.

See also:
findPeak()
Fit()
Parameters:
h - fitted histogram
fitparams - found parameters: Landau sigma, Landau mean, Gaus sigma
fiterrors - found errors of fitparams
peak - found peak position.
epeak - found error of peak position. 100000, numerical calculation: 0.00001 )
